results.title: For my true love
results.creator_credit: Russell Varney, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Russell and Wendy were both diagnosed with HIV they resolved to lean on each other as they feared discrimination. Eventually they reached out to organisations like Straight Arrows and started to feel alive again.

results.title: For me and my gal
results.creator_credit: Busby Berkeley, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Two of MGM’s brightest stars, Gene Kelly in his film debuty and Judy Garland, teamed in this Busby Berkeley musical about a vaudeville song-and-dance duo who buck tough times and World War I on the way to showbusiness success. The film has a collection of nostalgic gems including “Smiles”, “Ballin’ the Jack” and the title tune. Kelly’s inimitable dance style shines and Garland sustains her position as one of the greatest Hollywood legends. Bursting with energy, this is an old-fashioned musical for everyone who loves the movies.

results.title: For love or money: a history of women and work in Australia
results.creator_credit: Jeni Thornley, Margot Oliver, Margot Nash, Megan McMurchy and Flashback Films
results.brief_description: Tells the story of women’s working lives throughout Australia’s history. Juxtaposes clips from feature films, home movies, newsreels and documentaries with radio shows, diaries, popular songs, letters and interviews. Explores the challenges that face women in the nuclear age. Narrated by Noni Hazlehurst; edited by Margot Nash; music by Elizabeth Drake.

results.title: For Love Alone
results.creator_credit: Stephen Wallace, Margaret Fink, Australian Film Commission and Western Film Productions
results.brief_description: The time - the early 1930s. The woman - Teresa Hawkins, 20; her occupation University student. Her degree - love. She studies it with a passion. It is all consuming. She is obsessed. In the 1930s women were not supposed to believe in free love and independence. But that doesn’t stop Teresa. Helen Buday gives an outstanding performance as a woman years ahead of her time. Sam Neill, Hugo Weaving and Huw Williams play three of the men who become part of her passionate life. Based on the novel by Christina Stead.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen Wallace, Margaret Fink, Australian Film Commission and Western Film Productions

results.title: For land's sake
results.creator_credit: Hugh Foulds, Don Worobey, John Taylor, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Buying land to build a house on can be a problem. Urban sprawl, unscrupulous developers, zoning laws and other bureaucratic complexities can dim the enthusiasm of even the hardest candidates. Using animation and humour we are shown the difficulties encountered by a couple who want to build “a little house out in the country”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hugh Foulds, Don Worobey, John Taylor, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: For gentlemen only
results.creator_credit: Michael Scott, Vladmir Valenta, Roman Kroitor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The story of two retired old men whose comfortable world is threatened when their hotel, formerly for gentlemen only, decides to admit women. The film shows how they react to and cope with this change. (Award: Toronto)

results.title: For all who served
results.creator_credit: Jack Holdsworth, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Jack Holdsworth is one of the few remaining ‘Rats of Tobruk’. Here he reflects fondly on his time during the war and how the extreme circumstances created a strong bond between soldiers and their commanding officers. This bond, as Jack puts it, is a ‘hard habit to break’.
